page.title: 08Past Industry, Wye Valley.
page.content: In this area industry in the past depended on the water power provided by White Brook and Manor Brook. Several mills were built to harness the energy of the water. The type of industry which evolved included wire making, paper making and grinding corn. The other main industry was farming. In the Whitebrook Valley there were a corn mill, some wire works and paper mills. The wire made here was used to make pins, nails, needles, chains, fish hooks and sheep combing cards. Wire making began around 1568 and continued until 1880. There were 5 paper mills in Whitebrook; production started in 1760. The buildings of Fernside Mill still remain intact, and some of the old mills have been renovated into luxury accommodation.
